page.title: 10Farming - a personal account
page.content: Small farms are between{50 and 150 {acres.}The farm which I live on is 95 acres,but it is unlike other small farms,spread about over quite a large area.Our land has varying soil types ranging from{medium loam to heavy {clay,}and so the crops vary accordingly. The crops we grow are winter barley, winter wheat, spring barley, and grass.Occasionally we try other crops, but we usually stick to those mentionned above.The winter wheat and winter barley are sown in October and the spring barley in April.All our crops are harvested in the summer,the winter wheat,winter barley and spring barley are harvested in August and the hay is cut and made in June and July. We do supplement our income by buying, fattening, and selling cattle through the winter and we use their manure.
